S8.T1.caption: Table 1: Percentage of clients’ VerFedSVs in the total sum of VerFedSVs
S8.T1.table:
Adult Web Covtype
all regular clients 99.88 99.73 97.77
artificial client 1 0.01 0.02 0.39
artificial client 2 0.05 0.06 0.57
artificial client 3 0.03 0.06 0.91
artificial client 4 0.01 0.07 0.36
artificial client 5 0.02 0.06 0.01
references: In this experiment, we show that clients with randomly generated features will receive low evaluations under synchronous setting. Besides the regular clients, for each data set, we add 5 more clients whose features are randomly generated according to different distributions. More precisely, for new client i∈{1,…,5}𝑖1…5i\in\{1,\dots,5\}, the features are generated from Gaussian distribution with mean equal to i𝑖i and variance equal to i2superscript𝑖2i^{2}. We show in the Table 1 the percentage of clients’ VerFedSVs in the total sum of VerFedSVs, where the number of clients for the Adult, Web and Covtype datasets is, respectively, M=8,20,14𝑀82014M=8,20,14. As we can see from the table, regardless of the distributions, clients with randomly generated features receive much lower valuations than the regular clients for all the datasets.

S8.T2.caption: Table 2: Percentage of clients’ VerFedSVs in the total sum of VerFedSVs
S8.T2.table:
Adult Web Covtype
all regular clients 97.91 98.39 98.57
artificial client 1 0.93 0.26 0.35
artificial client 2 0.06 0.31 0.21
artificial client 3 0.33 0.36 0.22
artificial client 4 0.43 0.40 0.25
artificial client 5 0.35 0.28 0.39
references: In this experiment, we show that clients with randomly generated features will receive low evaluations regardless of their communication frequencies. Besides the regular clients, for each data set, we add 5 more clients whose features are randomly generated according to standard Gaussian distribution. They have communication frequencies such new client i∈{1,…,5}𝑖1…5i\in\{1,\dots,5\} will communicate with the server every 0.01​i0.01𝑖0.01i seconds. We show in the Table 2 the percentage of clients’ VerFedSVs in the total sum of VerFedSVs, where the number of clients for the Adult, Web and Covtype datasets is, respectively, M=8,20,14𝑀82014M=8,20,14. As we can see from the table, regardless of the communication frequencies, clients with randomly generated features receive much lower valuations than the regular clients for all the datasets.
